Sentencas: Novel compounds in the Bi-Al-O and La-Bi-Al-O systems were prepared and tested for conductivity at high temperatures (500-800-degrees-C) in an oxygen gradient cell.
The purpose is to develop an electrolyte material that will permit operation of a solid oxide fuel cell at 500-800-degrees-C instead of the 1000-degrees-C now used.
The Bi-Al-O and La-Bi-Al-O compounds were found to have conductivities of about 10(-2)
OMEGA-1 cm-1 at 800-degrees-C, respectively, in an oxygen gradient and may have the needed conductivity and stability toward humidified hydrogen for use as fuel cell electrolytes.
